VII.i.2.E.11.b
.
Full Concurrent Payment of DIC and SBP for Surviving Spouses Who Remarry Upon Attaining Age 57
Per
Sharp et al. v. the United States
, 580 F.3d 1234 (Fed. Cir. 2009), there is no bar to full concurrent payment of the Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) and the basic DIC rate when a surviving spouse is entitled to DIC by virtue of having remarried upon attaining age 57.
References
:  For more information on
surviving spouse’s entitlement to DIC when remarriage occurs upon attaining age 57, see
38 CFR 3.55(a)(10)
, and
SBP, see
M21-1, Part XII, Subpart i, 4.C
.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section E - Remarriage of a Surviving Spouse
